title: How to Make Pizza Pops

steps.headline: Mix together the pepperoni, pizza sauce, black olives, pepper, ham, and the cheese.
Roll the package of pizza dough into a 10X20 inch rectangle.
Cut in half lengthwise, leaving thinner strips.
Cut each piece into 4, equaling 8 pieces.
Take out the filling and divide it amongst the pieces.
Brush the adjacent edges of each piece with water.
Then fold the pieces of dough into a triangle shape, making sure the edges are sealed tightly.
Using your hands, maneuver the filling throughout the dough pocket.
Place the pizza pops on a baking tray.
Poke 2-3 holes in the top of the pop, making sure it doesn't spill over, which will keep it from spilling while baking.
steps.description: This acts as a ventilation for air.

steps.headline: Bake these pizza pops for 15 minutes on 400 °F (204 °C).

text: Take a mixing bowl.  Mix together the pepperoni, pizza sauce, black olives, pepper, ham, and the cheese.  Roll the package of pizza dough into a 10X20 inch rectangle.  Cut in half lengthwise, leaving thinner strips.  Cut each piece into 4, equaling 8 pieces.  Take out the filling and divide it amongst the pieces.  Brush the adjacent edges of each piece with water.  Then fold the pieces of dough into a triangle shape, making sure the edges are sealed tightly.  Using your hands, maneuver the filling throughout the dough pocket.  Place the pizza pops on a baking tray.  Poke 2-3 holes in the top of the pop, making sure it doesn't spill over, which will keep it from spilling while baking. This acts as a ventilation for air. Bake these pizza pops for 15 minutes on 400 °F (204 °C).  Or until golden brownish.  Cool at room temperature.  Serves 8
